instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1369: What is A1369? A1369 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2392, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2838, 820-3023..
definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no power. I have green light, but no fan spin.
The first voltage that i missed in the power rails are:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> = 0V

Couldn't figure iut where they are created to follow the trace. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
This board will not turn on without pressing power button.
Do you get L7750 voltage?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
This schematic has the power on sequence on page 3.
Did you check <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reaction?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1369</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
tks for the tip on the power on sequence  page.
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>  gets low when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> gets pressed and i have fan spin. It seams that the problem is the power buttun.

TKS!.
